act:act.act:title: Sechelt Indian Government District Home Owner Grant Act

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Act, district means the Sechelt Indian Government District recognized by section 17 of the Sechelt Indian Band Self-Government Act (Canada).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may pay to the district, out of money appropriated for that purpose, a grant in place of benefits payable under the Home Owner Grant Act.
The minister may attach conditions to a grant paid under subsection (1) with respect to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the persons to whom the district must pass on the benefit of the grant, and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the persons who are entitled to the benefit will be determined, and
the amount of the benefits to them will be determined and calculated.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (2), the minister may attach different conditions for different classes of persons.
If the district fails to comply with a condition of the minister under subsection (2) or (3), the minister may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: withhold all or part of the grant appropriated for the purposes of this Act in any subsequent year, and
order that a municipal benefit referred to in section 4 (1) of the Sechelt Indian Government District Enabling Act, not be paid or conferred.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the minister makes an order under subsection (4) (b), the person who is authorized to make the payment or confer the benefit must comply with the minister's order.
